info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 18 at 6:38PM EDT until June 19 at 11:41AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following creek in Indiana...
Wildcat Creek at Kokomo.
.The Wildcat Creek at Kokomo in north central Indiana is rapidly rising from the heavy rainfall that moved through Indiana this afternoon and early evening. Flood stage is expected to be reached this evening and cause minor flooding near the creek during the overnight hours.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wildcat Creek at Kokomo.
* WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water begins to overflow in local parks.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 10.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Thursday morning by around 945 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING
